messages.message:
*RE: Idea for improving issue reporting/tracking in <#C05BJCNKZAM|> & <#C0516UPPMT3|>:*

:bongo_cat_chill:  Just an idea, *NOT* urgent :slowparrot:

I was discussing a few ideas w/ @Nathaniel and we figured it could be worth it to share an *idea to make the lives of EPD (and reporters) easier when it comes to handling the crazy volume of `support` and `feedback` inquiries in our two main issue-reporting channels:*
• The solution could be a built-in Slack bot and/or Converse dynamically updated chatbot that:
    a. *Screens your typed message/query* in AI hub feedback/AI hub support channels
    b. *Before sending the message to the chat, checks your message against the content of the channel you're posting in to see if the issue has already been discussed* ("recently" (variable window) and "ever")
    c. *Pops-up links to related threads you can navigate to* so you can respond there instead of posting a new message 
        i. *OR you can* choose to bypass and *"post anyways"*
        ii. The solution can also a*utomatically add "_possibly related threads/issues/tickets_" at the end of your message as additional context* for the reviewing parties.
    d. Maybe *auto generate a `<interval>` report* o*f the most "common" / top-k trending terms/issues/affected product surfaces, with a list of threads as added context*
*Benefits:*
• This could help *reduce engineering/support effort and time for both EPD + the reporter*.
    ◦ _Ex. Just this week, I was the third person (back-to-back, I'm pretty sure) to post in one of our channels about `review metrics` being down, and having the heads-up would have probably saved time (I could have probably scrolled up / searched, too, but_ :oops: :lil_nervous: :bow:_)_
• *Support feedback programs*, *such as the recently revived monthly "Field to EPD" feedback meetings* where "field reps" highlight issues/submit tickets on behalf of their teams/depts to EPD.
• *Potentially,* this could be *a marketable "issue screener" integration for other companies* to use in Slack/AI Hub, too?
*Notes:*
• The essence of this use-case may already be captured in the roadmap/use-case vision for `Search` <#C06JCLSTLAW|> 
• Sounds potentially resource intensive, but sharing anyways :oprah_yougeta: 
Thanks for reading this short novel :pusheen-read-research:
